channel.title: Hiking on Grass Journal
channel.description: Recent content in Hiking on Grass Journal

item.title: Light Hiking New Mexico
item.description: Up in the high valleys of the Sangre de Cristo mountains, the snow has begun to melt. Patches of snow remain below the aspen groves, or on northern slopes. High up, around 9,500 feet, the snow is still deep. Near Agua Piedra (rock water) I found a closed trail headed up to a valley. We parked the truck down the road, and walked past closed summer cabins to the beginning. A creek ran quickly to the left.
